reviews.review_msg: Ironically awful communicator for a professor. Richard is not a good teacher in all aspects - he is not approachable nor is he helpful. The textbook is useless and assignment instructions are long winded and confusing. Please do yourself a favour and dont contact this professor for any help. Go straight to the TA - theyre more helpful.

You teach yourself. Detailed course outline. Relevant topics and examples in readings. Exam questions require attention to detail and good memory. Intense marking rubric, and a little unclear to specifics. TA available for help and marks all work.

I am taking distance education. Basically, you are on your own. You pay for the class, pay for the textbook and you answer questions, do assignments and have exams.  I think this class is a joke. If this is all I do, why did I have to pay anyone to "teach me"?

Many students seemed bored but I was fascinated by the material every class. Easy to keep up when interested. This class is great for internet geeks. Great textbook too, I've kept it! Richard is a smart and interesting man with a passion for what he teaches.

this prof is again not a serious instructor, at least for 253.. so boring, such low expectations of students, I just didn't feel motivated by this class. I could hardly sit through a class/tutl I was so BORED. Lec/tutl are constant YT clips-this is not what school is about, its just demoralizing. text is fun&whimsical, assgmnts are easy. but srsly.
Tough midterm, you can't fall behind. But it's easy to keep up, especially because it's so interesting and he makes his lectures interactive, intriguing, and relevant.
Love him.  He's wonderful.  Watch out for the midterm though!  It's terrible.
Richard Smith is a perfect human, ok thats going too far, but he is my favorite at sfu

Richard Smith is the MAN! His lectures are extremely interesting as well as extremely organized. You can tell he enjoys what he does! By far one of the best Prof's I've had in the CMNS department at SFU

Richard smith is the reason why i am still in CMNS. He is pure innovative brilliance! If it wasnt agaisnt the law to follow him around all day just listening to him..i would... Just like your wedding day, or the day your child is born, CMNS 253 will be considered one of the best experiences of your life..

The class is pretty difficult, but really interesting.  Although it requires quite a bit of work, and is also quite on the technological side of things for a CMNS course, it is very fun and extremely engaging.  I learned a ton from this course.  Midterm and accompanying assignments are very fair.

Very good prof.  I had an absolute disdain for technology before taking this course and he made me appreciate it and look at the "big picture."  Lectures are interesting and engaging.  A bit on the tough/scientific side though (for a CMNS course).
No Comments

really into what he teaches, always sending emails re technology, really keeps up with the latest stuff...however he's in serious denial about the difficulty of his class and has totally unrealistic expectations for his students - stubborn, unfair, biased

What more can you ask for than a prof who loves what he teaches? Very enthusiastic...puts the G in GEEK though! Seems willing to help if you need it. Course isn't that hard, fair bit of work though. Midterm was very fair.
knows his stuf, interesting, incorp diff sources, creative projects for learning
No Comments
Class with Devan feels more like a fashion show than actual class, but he really cares about students and it's easy to make office hours with him and figure out what to do.
Frederik has a lovely, dry sense of humour. He's not the most engaging prof but it's the first time he's taught this course so I'd say pretty good first attempt.

AWESOME prof, lectures are absolutely interesting, he's not the type to read off a slide and he uses good videos and pictures to enhance his lecture :) I don't know how he marks, but theres no midterm or final, just a movie project: Awesome x2! BTW I think he deserves a chili pepper ;)
I had him for TA and Prof. He is extremely a hard marker. Warning  low marks for everything! But his teaching is really clear and easily understanding.

Super picky and if you are not a good writer. Don't even bother with this course because it will become your next tomb and he is insanely picky about those little nitty technicality or the controversial issues. And he marks your essay based on his oppnion and he even made a marking mistake before and yet reluctent to change the grade.

What can I say really? Very picky about the writing assignments to the smallest details that are very controversial. Extremely hard marker, almost impossible to get good marks. Attidue is pretty good, but that's probably a deception from marking insanely hard.
Nice prof, good understand on the course material and make it fun. Course was fun and engaging. Marking was tough tho.

GREAT lecturer. If you have a chance to take a class with him, don't pass it up. He knows so much about EVERYTHING, it still blows my mind. He's got nteresting perspectives and will open your mind to knew ideas.
he is a hilarious very well read engaging professor, an ideal renegade academic
lots of knowledge, loads of fun... took his course when his kid died. despite that he still taught great that term. all the respect to him!
Best Prof Ever
Very entertaining and helpful prof! Super nice and willing to assist, let alone hilarious and fun! Having another class w/him this semester again! Yeah~
One of my favourite SFU profs!
Very entertaining lectures. Great guy to learn from.
Best prof ever had.  Makes lecture fun.
best teacher ever....easy too
Not funny, voice too soothing = sleep, strange
No Comments
He's got a great sense of humour and has lots of experience behind him.

I wouldn't ever take a class with Mirjam again. The class was graded and presented way harder than it needed to be. I don't feel like she understood the class material herself. She always gave extremely intense feedback on all assignments and it always made little to no sense. This prof brought me more stress than any sort of learning.

Mirjam is easily the worst instructor I have ever taken a class with. Her feedback on assignments is highly contradictory, makes little to no sense, and provided no help whatsoever. Mirjam is very out of touch with students and honestly quite rude. I would never take a class with her again or recommend anyone else to.
Cressman is super-fantastic! He's young and hip and is extremely interested in what he's teaching, which makes it interesting for everyone else. I think he's a fantastic instructor, very nice too.

I enjoyed Kate's teaching style. She's tough, she's bold and isn't afraid to approach contentious topics - really made the coursework come alive for me. You need to be confident and strong when approaching her, and speaking in class; if you can do this, you will win her respect and the class will be more enjoyable for you.

Absolutely the worst TA I've ever met in my entire life. Opinionative, egostic, self-centered, rude, has major attitude problems, disorganized during lectures, completely biased, and refused to mark the exam properly. She has to be the worst of the worst in SFU. I want my money back. It's a complete waste for this course.

I thought he was pretty easy. He gave you the material for the course, what was on the midterm was on the lecture notes and readings. It wasn't hard at all. TA was pretty nice too and helped out a lot.

Jean is great.  Very helpful and wants you to succeed, you just have to make the effort and ask questions if you're confused with something.  Super smart and very interested in the subject. He's like a walking library.  Don't listen to these other ratings they're horrible, he's obviously made the effort to change things. I really enjoyed his class.

Too much work, even for a writing course. I think the course itself covers TOO much for such a short amount of time. So i ended up not learning anything in-depth. Lectures are so dreadful. TAs are alright though. The professor tries hard to make it fun, but not successful. Sorry. Too much reading.

I like him. I don't understand the previous comment. He made a joke about some kid who owns a baby grand... and asked who had what kind of phones... no one had to answer.He does go a little fast in lecture, I gae up on taking notes, and just got everything from the online wiki. I hated how the paper needed drafts, I can't write like that.

Focus on readings for midterms and his lectures for assigments and ideas. He sums up nicely for each chapter but do not rely it for midterm b/c it's tricky. Very easy going- encourage students to ask question by getting them to text him. Very passionate about his material but his presentation is okay because he reads off from the slide. Cute.
